Course Schedule

Mathematical Modelling of Infectious Diseases (Malaria)

This intensive two-week program provides comprehensive training in mathematical modeling of infectious diseases with a focus on malaria. The curriculum covers fundamental concepts in epidemiology, advanced modelling techniques, economic evaluation, and effective communication of modelling results to stakeholders.

Week 1

Day 1: Introduction to Epidemiology (Monday, August 18)

Time Activity Facilitator(s)
08:00 - 09:00 Ice-breaker Session Purity
09:00 - 11:00 Lesson 1: Definitions of public health, epidemiology, & models; Fundamental principles and terminology; Methods for measuring disease frequency George Paul
11:00 - 11:30 Coffee Break
11:30 - 13:30 Lesson 2: Role of epidemiology in public health & disease control; Epidemiology study designs and their applications Geoffrey/Alice
13:30 - 14:30 Lunch Break
14:30 - 16:30 Lesson 3: R programming fundamentals and data visualization Njoki/Alice
16:30 - 17:00 Trainer Session

Day 2: Basics of Infectious Disease Modelling (Tuesday, August 19)

Time Activity Facilitator(s)
08:00 - 10:00 Lesson 4: Introduction to mathematical modelling (role of modelling and types of models); Introduction to generic compartmental models Geoffrey/Billy
10:00 - 10:30 Coffee Break
10:30 - 12:30 Lesson 5: Model construction - constructing a simple malaria model (SIS diagrams) STPH (Emilie, Cameline, Billy)/Njoki
12:30 - 13:30 Lunch Break
13:30 - 15:30 Lesson 6: Flow diagram to differential equations (simple malaria model) STPH (Emilie, Cameline, Billy)/Njoki
15:30 - 16:00 Coffee Break
16:00 - 17:00 Tutorial on generic compartmental models

Day 3: Introduction to Malaria Modelling (Wednesday, August 20)

Time Activity Facilitator(s)
08:00 - 10:00 Lesson 7: Constructing and analyzing simple infectious disease models (coding, solving equations) STPH (Emilie, Cameline, Billy)/John Ojal
10:00 - 10:30 Coffee Break
10:30 - 12:30 Lesson 8: Elementary vector-host model (malaria model) Stephanie/John O
12:30 - 13:30 Lunch Break
13:30 - 15:30 Lesson 9: Adding complexity to malaria models (age, seasonality, immunity, treatment) Stephanie/John O
15:30 - 16:00 Coffee Break
16:00 - 17:00 Tutorial Session

Day 4: Model Integration of Malaria Interventions (Thursday, August 21)

Time Activity Facilitator(s)
08:00 - 10:00 Lesson 10: Interventions of malaria models STPH/Stephanie
10:00 - 10:30 Coffee Break
10:30 - 12:30 Lesson 11: Scenario analysis STPH/Stephanie
12:30 - 13:30 Lunch Break
13:30 - 15:30 Lesson 12: Version control using Git and GitHub to manage and share R code Alice
15:30 - 16:00 Coffee Break
16:00 - 17:00 Introduction to Group Projects Cameline/STPH/Mutono

Day 5: Sensitivity Analysis & R Coding (Friday, August 22)

Time Activity Facilitator(s)
08:00 - 10:00 Lesson 14: Sensitivity analysis Ivy/Mutono
10:00 - 10:30 Coffee Break

12:30 - 13:30 Lunch Break
13:30 - 15:30 Group Project Work Cameline/STPH/Mutono
15:30 - 16:00 Coffee Break
16:00 - 17:00 Trainer Session

Full day excursion and recreational activities

Checkout and departures

Note: This schedule is subject to minor adjustments based on the progress and needs of participants. Coffee and lunch breaks are scheduled to provide opportunities for informal discussions and networking.
